channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: After second fatal DHS shooting in Minnesota, state officials fight for role in probe
item.description: Minnesota officials are demanding to have a role in the investigation into Alex Pretti's killing by federal agents as videos and eyewitnesses contradict the Trump administration's account.
item.content:encoded: Minnesota officials are demanding to have a role in the investigation into Alex Pretti's killing by federal agents as videos and eyewitnesses contradict the Trump administration's account.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Minnesota official talks about fatal shooting of man by immigration agent
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Bob Jacobson, the commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Public Safety, about the fatal shooting of 37-year-old intensive care nurse Alex Pretti.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Bob Jacobson, the commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Public Safety, about the fatal shooting of 37-year-old intensive care nurse Alex Pretti.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Thousands of homes in several states without power after massive winter storm
item.description: The massive winter storm that spread across a wide swath of the country this weekend left hundreds of thousands of homes without power.
item.content:encoded: The massive winter storm that spread across a wide swath of the country this weekend left hundreds of thousands of homes without power.
item.dc:creator: Blake Farmer

item.title: Former Columbia University president's new book explores attacks on higher education
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Lee C. Bollinger, former president of Columbia University and author of the new book, "University: A Reckoning."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Lee C. Bollinger, former president of Columbia University and author of the new book, "University: A Reckoning."
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Pierre L'enfant designed the look of the U.S. capital but died in obscurity
item.description: Pierre L'Enfant was a lowly French engineer when he met George Washington at Valley Forge. Washington recruited him to make the design for the nation's new capital city. L'Enfant made the plans, but his personality was so abrasive, he was pushed out of the project.
item.content:encoded: Pierre L'Enfant was a lowly French engineer when he met George Washington at Valley Forge. Washington recruited him to make the design for the nation's new capital city. L'Enfant made the plans, but his personality was so abrasive, he was pushed out of the project.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A 37-year-old man was killed by federal officers in Minneapolis, sparking new protests; many Senate Democrats say they plan to vote against DHS funding; winter storm knocks out power to thousands.
item.content:encoded: A 37-year-old man was killed by federal officers in Minneapolis, sparking new protests; many Senate Democrats say they plan to vote against DHS funding; winter storm knocks out power to thousands.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Political blame game continues after second fatal Minneapolis shooting
item.description: A second person was killed in Minneapolis over the weekend by federal officials. The political finger-pointing began almost immediately.
item.content:encoded: A second person was killed in Minneapolis over the weekend by federal officials. The political finger-pointing began almost immediately.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: The rise of data centers is becoming a midterm issue for voters
item.description: Data centers used to fuel artificial intelligence are popping up all over the country, and they're becoming a midterm issue for voters that's now drawing White House attention.
item.content:encoded: Data centers used to fuel artificial intelligence are popping up all over the country, and they're becoming a midterm issue for voters that's now drawing White House attention.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Rideshare drivers in California can now unionize for better pay and conditions
item.description: Rideshare drivers in California can now unionize and collectively bargain for better pay and working conditions. It's the second state after Massachusetts to allow drivers to organize.
item.content:encoded: Rideshare drivers in California can now unionize and collectively bargain for better pay and working conditions. It's the second state after Massachusetts to allow drivers to organize.
item.dc:creator: Laura Fitzgerald

item.title: As GLP-1s become more available, some who aren't overweight may consider using them
item.description: As GLP-1 drugs become more available, some people might use them despite not having excess weight.
item.content:encoded: As GLP-1 drugs become more available, some people might use them despite not having excess weight.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi
